result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron J Spencer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
With Huber

**06-03-15/Order**
Amending JOC by removing the word "consecutive"
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.
Provide DNA sample.

No contact with firearms.
Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

No IN PERSON contact with victim, unless approved by court or agent.
Defendant may have phone and electronic contact. Court advised the no contact order should be reviewed by DOC agent after defendant has completed 6 BIP classes.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.

Batterers Intervention program.
Fatherhood program.
Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

timeConds.notes: Serve 40 DAYS as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron J Spencer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Aaron J Spencer in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

This case was calendared for a jury trial date in error.
Jury trial date vacated.
cab
Signed & Filed, Order Amending the Judgment of Conviction.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Lindsey Grady, Br. 23, for review. mag

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1 AS AMENDED
The court sentenced the defendant to 80 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive, with Huber.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 15 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 40 DAYS as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Fatherhood program.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No IN PERSON contact with victim, unless approved by court or agent. Defendant may have phone and electronic contact. Court advised the no contact order should be reviewed by DOC agent after defendant has completed 6 BIP classes.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation

AS TO COUNT 1 AS AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

Defendant Aaron J Spencer in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Final Pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. 
AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse Assessment, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), 973.055(1), a Class B Misdemeanor.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Aaron J Spencer in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case RECALLED. Halima S. present in court requesting modification of the No Contact orders.  State opposes.  Court allows for third party contact between defendant and Halima S. through Halima S.'s mother for financial arrangements. Case remains set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trail in branch 23.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Court adjusted cash bail down to $250.00, balance to be refunded. All other terms remain in effect.

Defendant Aaron J Spencer in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM018915  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04-11-15
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with HALIMA S.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Aaron J Spencer in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Defendant Aaron J Spencer in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
